bio:
Ann Chen is a Visiting Assistant Arts Professor at NYU Shanghai. She is a Brooklyn based artist and filmmaker whose work explores intersection of the built and natural environment through photography, film, writings, sound recordings and maps.

Chen was an inaugural Fulbright National Geographic Digital Storytelling Fellow (2014-15), visiting research fellow at the University of Alberta in English and Film Studies, UnionDocs Collaborative Studio Fellow(2015-16), Sprint fellow at The Public Laboratory for Open Technology and Science(2016) and received an Eco-Leadership grant from Fulbright Canada (2016). Her writings have appeared in After Oil (2016) and in National Geographic Voices blog (2014-15).

Research Interests

  • Multimedia art
  • Documentary media production and methodologies
  • Visual ethnography and geography
  • Infrastructure

Recent Publications

  • 2016 Night Shift, Everyday!, short film, editor
  • 2016 Coming Soon, short film, director, producer
  • 2016 After Oil, book, contributor
  • 2014-15 Voices, National Geographic, online
  • 2013 Fingers, Recess Arts, Online

Education

  • MPS, Interactive Telecommunications Program, New York University, 2013
  • BA with honors, College of Letters, Wesleyan University, 2003

Languages

  • English
  • Knowledge of Chinese and French
